user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl:
```c
void OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl(uint32 ModeBits)
{
    char param[32];

    if (OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.EnableTermControl)
    {
        if (ModeBits == OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL)
        {
            OS_BSP_ExecTput("sgr0", NULL);
        }
        else
        {
            if ((ModeBits & OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT) == 0)
            {
                /* no highlight (standout) text */
                OS_BSP_ExecTput("rmso", NULL);
            }
            else
            {
                /* set highlight (standout) text */
                OS_BSP_ExecTput("smso", NULL);
            }

            snprintf(param, sizeof(param), "%d", OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_TO_ANSICOLOR(ModeBits));
            OS_BSP_ExecTput("setaf", param);
        }
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl:
#define OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL 0x0
...
#define OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT 0x8
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
OS_BSP_ExecTput("smso", NULL);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call is reachable when OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.EnableTermControl is true and the ModeBits parameter has the OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT bit set (i.e. (ModeBits & OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT) != 0). In that case execution takes the else branch and OS_BSP_ExecTput("smso", NULL) is executed.
